cyclone.name: JERRY
cyclone.trajectory: moving north, forecast to turn northeast tonight and then east-northeast on Wednesday, passing near Bermuda and continuing over the open Atlantic away from the U.S. mainland and the Caribbean
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Bermuda (close pass, not a direct landfall)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watches confined to Bermuda area only
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning in effect for Bermuda only
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Swells affecting northern Leeward Islands and Puerto Rico coast, direct impacts otherwise limited to Bermuda
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: Not listed (Puerto Rico/San Juan not in wind-probability table)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are not expected at San Juan; only gentle to moderate breezes from peripheral circulation.
weather_observation.rainfall: Scattered outer-band showers possible; widespread heavy rain is not expected.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along north-facing beaches due to long-period swells.
